TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridViewHeaderCell extends System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell

Docs.summary: Contains functionality common to row header cells and column header cells.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class is a base class for other header cell classes, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>. To create custom row header icons or column header glyphs, inherit from the DataGridViewHeaderCell class and add functionality to paint your own icon or glyph.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the buttonlike visual state of the header cell.
Docs.value: One of the values; the default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> is like a button in that it can be clicked to set states, such as sorting or performing row-level selection. The ButtonState property uses <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState?displayProperty=fullName> values to provide buttonlike visual states.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an exact copy of this cell.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Override the Clone method whenever you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> and add new properties to the derived class.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the cell is currently displayed on-screen.
Docs.value: if the cell is on-screen or partially on-screen; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
Gets the type of the formatted value of the cell.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Value%2A> property is the actual data object contained by the cell, whereas the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue%2A> property is the formatted representation of the data. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ValueType%2A> and FormattedValueType properties correspond to the data types of these values, respectively.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cell is frozen.
Docs.value: if the cell is frozen; otherwise, . The default is if the cell is detached from a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Frozen property is `true` if the cell belongs to a frozen row or column, or if the cell is the top-left header cell. A cell, row, or column is frozen when its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.State%2A> property has a value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates?displayProperty=fullName>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip GetInheritedContextMenuStrip(int32 rowIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: Ignored by this implementation.
Docs.summary: Gets the shortcut menu of the header cell.
Docs.returns: A if the or has a shortcut menu assigned; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> does not have a shortcut menu, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> will inherit the shortcut menu from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>. If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> also does not have a shortcut menu, then the GetInheritedContextMenuStrip method will return `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates GetInheritedState(int32 rowIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the row containing the cell or -1 if the cell is not a row header cell or is not contained within a control.
Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating the current state of the cell as inherited from the state of its row or column.
Docs.returns: A bitwise combination of values representing the current state of the cell.
Docs.exception:
The cell is a row header cell, the cell is not contained within a control, and is not -1.
\- or -
The cell is a row header cell, the cell is contained within a control, and is outside the valid range of 0 to the number of rows in the control minus 1.
\- or -
The cell is a row header cell and is not the index of the row containing this cell.
The cell is a column header cell or the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.TopLeftHeaderCell%2A> and is not -1.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Size GetSize(int32 rowIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The row index of the header cell.
Docs.summary: Gets the size of the cell.
Docs.returns: A that represents the size of the header cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetSize method returns the size necessary to fit in a row of column headers if the header cell is a column header, the size necessary to fit in a column of row headers if the header cell is a row header, or the size necessary to be a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTopLeftHeaderCell> if the cell is a top left header cell.
If the cell is not attached to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Size%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> returns the value (-1,-1).

Docs.exception:
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.DataGridView%2A> property for this cell is and does not equal -1.
-or-
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningColumn%2A> property for this cell is not and does not equal -1.
-or-
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningRow%2A> property for this cell is not and is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of rows in the control.
-or-
The values of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningColumn%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningRow%2A> properties of this cell are both and does not equal -1.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningRow%2A> property for this cell is not and indicates a row other than the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningRow%2A>.

Docs.param: The index of the cell's parent row.
Docs.summary: Gets the value of the cell.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool MouseDownUnsharesRow(class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains information about the mouse position.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
Docs.returns: if the user clicks with the left mouse button, visual styles are enabled, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
MouseDownUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseDown%2A>. It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseDown%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`. It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool MouseEnterUnsharesRow(int32 rowIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the row that the mouse pointer entered.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer moves over a cell in the row.
Docs.returns: if visual styles are enabled, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
MouseEnterUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseEnter%2A>. It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseEnter%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`. It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.param: The index of the row that the mouse pointer left.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer leaves the row.
Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> property value is not , visual styles are enabled, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
MouseLeaveUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseLeave%2A>. It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseLeave%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`. It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is released while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
Docs.returns: if the left mouse button was released, visual styles are enabled, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
MouseUpUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseUp%2A>. It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseUp%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`. It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseDown(class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains information about the mouse position.
Docs.summary: Called when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The OnMouseDown method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState> if the cell is clicked with the left mouse button and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseDown%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseDown?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseEnter(int32 rowIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the row containing the cell.
Docs.summary: Called when the mouse pointer enters the cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The OnMouseEnter method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState> if the left mouse button is pressed when the pointer enters the cell and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseEnter%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseEnter?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseLeave(int32 rowIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the row containing the cell.
Docs.summary: Called when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The OnMouseLeave method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState> if it was in another state and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseLeave%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseLeave?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseUp(class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains information about the mouse position.
Docs.summary: Called when the mouse button is released while the pointer is over the cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The OnMouseUp method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState> if the left mouse button was released and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseUp%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseUp?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool ReadOnly { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the header cell is read-only.
Docs.exception: An operation tries to set this property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cell is resizable.
Docs.value: if this cell can be resized; otherwise, . The default is if the cell is not attached to a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A row header cell is resizable if the row is resizable or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersWidthSizeMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeadersWidthSizeMode>. A column header cell is resizable if the column is resizable or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool Selected { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cell is selected.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not meaningful for header cells.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string that describes the current object.
Docs.returns: A string that represents the current object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Type ValueType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the value stored in the cell.
Gets a value indicating whether or not the cell is visible.
Docs.value: if the cell is visible; otherwise, . The default is if the cell is detached from a

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the cell is a row header cell, then it is visible if its row is visible and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A> property is `true`. If the cell is a column header cell, then it is visible if its column is visible and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersVisible%2A> property is `true`. If the cell is the top left header cell, it is visible if both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersVisible%2A> are true.
